subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 16 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Man Utd move interests Gudjohnsen
Barcelona star Eidur Gudjohnsen admits he would be tempted by a transfer to Man Utd.



 
Sheringham wants to keep playing
Veteran striker Teddy Sheringham says he is honoured to receive an MBE and wants to play on for as long as possible.



 
Botham honoured with knighthood
Ian Botham, Ryan Giggs and Teddy Sheringham are among the sports stars on the Queen's Birthday Honours List.








GOLF




Live - US Open
The early starters get their rounds under way on day three at Oakmont.



 
USGA stands firm on Oakmont test
Officials at the US Open restate their happiness with the Oakmont set-up despite calls to make it easier.



 
Cabrera powers into Oakmont lead
Argentine Angel Cabrera birdies the last to take a one-shot lead at the halfway stage of the US Open.








MOTORSPORT




Live - US GP qualifying
The battle for grid positions from the US Grand Prix at Indianapolis.



 
Alonso remains man to beat in US
World champion Fernando Alonso is quickest yet again before Saturday's qualifying for the US Grand Prix.



 
Toseland fourth on grid at Misano
World Superbikes championship leader Jame Toseland will start Sunday's San Marino races from fourth place on the grid.








FORMULA ONE




Live - US GP qualifying
The battle for grid positions from the US Grand Prix at Indianapolis.



 
Alonso remains man to beat in US
World champion Fernando Alonso is quickest yet again before Saturday's qualifying for the US Grand Prix.



 
Hamilton rejects Alonso complaint
Lewis Hamilton describes Fernando Alonso's claim that McLaren are favouring him as "strange".








ATHLETICS




Devonish best dashed by mistake
Marlon Devonish could see his 100m personal best removed from the records because of an administrative mistake in Oslo.



 
Idowu shines in Golden League win
Phillips Idowu beats the world's best triple jumpers to claim the opening Golden League meeting in Oslo.



 
Yelling withdraws from GB squad
Liz Yelling pulls out of the GB marathon squad for this summer's World Athletics Championships in Osaka.








CYCLING




Moreau into lead as Iglinsky wins
Frenchman Christophe Moreau leads the Dauphine Libere after the sixth stage is won by Kazakhstan's Maxim Iglinsky.



 
Basso handed two-year doping ban
Ivan Basso receives the maximum two-year doping ban from the Italian cycling federation.



 
Hammond eyes Tour de France spot
Briton Roger Hammond heads to the Tour de Suisse on Saturday hoping to secure a spot at next month's Tour de France.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Michael Vaughan hits the town as Messi keeps his hand in



 
Quotes of the Week
Ramon Calderon on David Beckham, plus Lewis Hamilton and Graham Taylor



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport
